intro: Polycarena sordida, commonly known as the dirty polycarp, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its small, inconspicuous flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. Its leaves are ovate to lanceolate in shape and often have a rough texture. Polycarena sordida is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
